meanings.definition: Not skilled in dealing with others in a sensitive or tactful way.
meanings.sent1: His undiplomatic comments offended many people at the party.
meanings.sent2: She always speaks in an undiplomatic manner, often causing misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: It was undiplomatic of him to loudly criticize the food at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Her undiplomatic behavior was like a bull in a china shop, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The undiplomatic email he sent was full of blunt and harsh language.

meanings.sent1: The undiplomatic approach to negotiations led to a breakdown in communication.
meanings.sent2: His undiplomatic response to the situation only made things worse.
meanings.sent3: It was undiplomatic of her to interrupt the meeting with a loud yawn.
meanings.sent4: The undiplomatic decision to ignore their concerns backfired spectacularly.
meanings.sent5: The undiplomatic behavior of the child caused a stir among the guests.

meanings.definition: Not diplomatic in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: Their undiplomatic remarks created tension in the room.
meanings.sent2: The undiplomatic tone of the letter was evident from the start.
meanings.sent3: It was undiplomatic of him to storm out of the meeting without explanation.
meanings.sent4: Her undiplomatic outburst was like a thunderstorm in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The undiplomatic behavior of the politician made headlines for all the wrong reasons.
